text: ਹੁਕਮੀ ਪੈਧਾ ਜਾਇ ਦਰਗਹ ਭਾਣੀਐ ॥

translation.text: If it pleases the Commander, one goes to His Court, robed in honor.

transliteration.text: hukamī paidhā jāi daragah bhānīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਹੁਕਮੇ ਹੀ ਸਿਰਿ ਮਾਰ ਬੰਦਿ ਰਬਾਣੀਐ ॥੫॥

translation.text: By His Command, God's slaves are hit over the head. ||5||

transliteration.text: hukamē hī sir mār band rabānīai .5.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਲਾਹਾ ਸਚੁ ਨਿਆਉ ਮਨਿ ਵਸਾਈਐ ॥

translation.text: The profit is earned by enshrining Truth and justice in the mind.

transliteration.text: lāhā sach niāu man vasāīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਲਿਖਿਆ ਪਲੈ ਪਾਇ ਗਰਬੁ ਵਞਾਈਐ ॥੬॥

translation.text: They obtain what is written in their destiny, and overcome pride. ||6||

transliteration.text: likhiā palai pāi garab vañāīai .6.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਮਨਮੁਖੀਆ ਸਿਰਿ ਮਾਰ ਵਾਦਿ ਖਪਾਈਐ ॥

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are hit over the head, and consumed by conflict.

transliteration.text: manamukhīā sir mār vād khapāīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਠਗਿ ਮੁਠੀ ਕੂੜਿਆਰ ਬੰਨ੍ਹਿ ਚਲਾਈਐ ॥੭॥

translation.text: The cheaters are plundered by falsehood; they are chained and led away. ||7||

transliteration.text: thag muthī kūriār bannh chalāīai .7.

It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਸਾਹਿਬੁ ਰਿਦੈ ਵਸਾਇ ਨ ਪਛੋਤਾਵਹੀ ॥

translation.text: Enshrine the Lord Master in your mind, and you shall not have to repent.

transliteration.text: sāhib ridai vasāi n pashōtāvahī .

text: ਗੁਨਹਾਂ ਬਖਸਣਹਾਰੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਕਮਾਵਹੀ ॥੮॥

translation.text: He forgives our sins, when we practice the Teachings of the Guru's Word. ||8||

transliteration.text: gunahānh bakhasanahār sabad kamāvahī .8.

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਮੰਗੈ ਸਚੁ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਘਾਲੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Nanak begs for the True Name, which is obtained by the Gurmukh.

transliteration.text: nānak mangai sach guramukh ghālīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਮੈ ਤੁਝ ਬਿਨੁ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਕੋਇ ਨਦਰਿ ਨਿਹਾਲੀਐ ॥੯॥੧੬॥

translation.text: Without You, I have no other at all; please, bless me with Your Glance of Grace. ||9||16||

transliteration.text: mai tujh bin avar n kōi nadar nihālīai .9.16.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਆਸਾ ਮਹਲਾ ੧ ॥

translation.text: Aasaa, First Mehl:

transliteration.text: āsā mahalā 1 .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਕਿਆ ਜੰਗਲੁ ਢੂਢੀ ਜਾਇ ਮੈ ਘਰਿ ਬਨੁ ਹਰੀਆਵਲਾ ॥

translation.text: Why should I go searching in the forests, when the woods of my home are so green?

transliteration.text: kiā jangal dhūdhī jāi mai ghar ban harīāvalā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਸਚਿ ਟਿਕੈ ਘਰਿ ਆਇ ਸਬਦਿ ਉਤਾਵਲਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The True Word of the Shabad has instantaneously come and settled in my heart. ||1||

transliteration.text: sach tikai ghar āi sabad utāvalā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਜਹ ਦੇਖਾ ਤਹ ਸੋਇ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੀਐ ॥

translation.text: Wherever I look, there He is; I know no other.

transliteration.text: jah dēkhā tah sōi avar n jānīai .

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਇ ਮਹਲੁ ਪਛਾਣੀਐ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Working for the Guru, one realizes the Mansion of the Lord's Presence. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: gur kī kār kamāi mahal pashānīai .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਆਪਿ ਮਿਲਾਵੈ ਸਚੁ ਤਾ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਵਈ ॥

translation.text: The True Lord blends us with Himself, when it is pleasing to His Mind.

transliteration.text: āp milāvai sach tā man bhāvaī .

text: ਚਲੈ ਸਦਾ ਰਜਾਇ ਅੰਕਿ ਸਮਾਵਈ ॥੨॥

translation.text: One who ever walks in accordance with His Will, merges into His Being. ||2||

transliteration.text: chalai sadā rajāi ank samāvaī .2.

text: ਸਚਾ ਸਾਹਿਬੁ ਮਨਿ ਵਸੈ ਵਸਿਆ ਮਨਿ ਸੋਈ ॥

translation.text: When the True Lord dwells in the mind, that mind flourishes.

transliteration.text: sachā sāhib man vasai vasiā man sōī .

text: ਆਪੇ ਦੇ ਵਡਿਆਈਆ ਦੇ ਤੋਟਿ ਨ ਹੋਈ ॥੩॥

translation.text: He Himself grants greatness; His Gifts are never exhausted. ||3||

transliteration.text: āpē dē vadiāīā dē tōt n hōī .3.

text: ਅਬੇ ਤਬੇ ਕੀ ਚਾਕਰੀ ਕਿਉ ਦਰਗਹ ਪਾਵੈ ॥

translation.text: Serving this and that person, how can one obtain the Lord's Court?

transliteration.text: abē tabē kī chākarī kiu daragah pāvai .

text: ਪਥਰ ਕੀ ਬੇੜੀ ਜੇ ਚੜੈ ਭਰ ਨਾਲਿ ਬੁਡਾਵੈ ॥੪॥

translation.text: If someone embarks on a boat of stone, he shall drown with its cargo. ||4||

transliteration.text: pathar kī bērī jē charai bhar nāl budāvai .4.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਆਪਨੜਾ ਮਨੁ ਵੇਚੀਐ ਸਿਰੁ ਦੀਜੈ ਨਾਲੇ ॥

translation.text: So offer your mind, and surrender your head with it.

transliteration.text: āpanarā man vēchīai sir dījai nālē .

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਸਤੁ ਪਛਾਣੀਐ ਅਪਨਾ ਘਰੁ ਭਾਲੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh realizes the true essence, and finds the home of his own self. ||5||

transliteration.text: guramukh vasat pashānīai apanā ghar bhālē .5.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

text: ਜੰਮਣ ਮਰਣਾ ਆਖੀਐ ਤਿਨਿ ਕਰਤੈ ਕੀਆ ॥

translation.text: People discuss birth and death; the Creator created this.

transliteration.text: janman maranā ākhīai tin karatai kīā .

text: ਆਪੁ ਗਵਾਇਆ ਮਰਿ ਰਹੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਮਰਣੁ ਨ ਥੀਆ ॥੬॥

translation.text: Those who conquer their selfhood and remain dead, shall never have to die again. ||6||

transliteration.text: āp gavāiā mar rahē phir maran n thīā .6.

text: ਸਾਈ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਵਣੀ ਧੁਰ ਕੀ ਫੁਰਮਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Do those deeds which the Primal Lord has ordered for you.

text: ਜੇ ਮਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੇ ਮਿਲੈ ਕਿਨਿ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾਈ ॥੭॥

translation.text: If one surrenders his mind upon meeting the True Guru, who can estimate its value? ||7||

text: ਰਤਨਾ ਪਾਰਖੁ ਸੋ ਧਣੀ ਤਿਨਿ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਪਾਈ ॥

translation.text: O Nanak, True is the Glory of that one, in whose mind the Lord Master dwells. ||8||17||

text: ਆਸਾ ਮਹਲਾ ੧ ॥

translation.text: Aasaa, First Mehl:

transliteration.text: āsā mahalā 1 .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਜਿਨ੍ਹੀ ਨਾਮੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਆ ਦੂਜੈ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Those who have forgotten the Naam, the Name of the Lord, are deluded by doubt and duality.

transliteration.text: jinhī nām visāriā dūjai bharam bhulāī .

translation.text: Those who abandon the roots and cling to the branches, shall obtain only ashes. ||1||

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਕਿਉ ਛੂਟੀਐ ਜੇ ਜਾਣੈ ਕੋਈ ॥

translation.text: Without the Name, how can one be emancipated? Who knows this?

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਹੋਇ ਤ ਛੂਟੀਐ ਮਨਮੁਖਿ ਪਤਿ ਖੋਈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: One who becomes Gurmukh is emancipated; the self-willed manmukhs lose their honor. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: guramukh hōi t shūtīai manamukh pat khōī .1. rahāu .

text: ਜਿਨ੍ਹੀ ਏਕੋ ਸੇਵਿਆ ਪੂਰੀ ਮਤਿ ਭਾਈ ॥

translation.text: Those who serve the One Lord become perfect in their understanding, O Siblings of Destiny.

text: ਆਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ ਨਿਰੰਜਨਾ ਜਨ ਹਰਿ ਸਰਣਾਈ ॥੨॥

text: ਗੁਰ ਬਿਨੁ ਕਿਨੈ ਨ ਪਾਇਓ ਕੇਤੀ ਕਹੈ ਕਹਾਏ ॥

text: ਮਨਮੁਖੁ ਜੇ ਸਮਝਾਈਐ ਭੀ ਉਝੜਿ ਜਾਏ ॥

translation.text: Even if the self-willed manmukh is instructed, he stills goes into the wilderness.

translation.text: Without the Lord's Name, he shall not be emancipated; he shall die, and sink into hell. ||5||

translation.text: He wanders through birth and death, and never chants the Lord's Name.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.
